title: Geth faild out of memory
body:
Geth panic of "out of memory" when trying to start a geth node as rpc/mine node in a private poa network, which is the first time that I try to start geth after initing private genesis block. 

But, it does success running after trying several times to restart it(do nothing expect repeating execute cmd), don't know reason why.

cmd: `geth --datadir data --unlock 0xe7e549d77b7e8ece9194147395745d2f83ad6301 --password pw --allow-insecure-unlock --mine --rpc --rpcapi web3,eth,net`
#### System information

Geth version: `Geth
Version: 1.9.18-stable
Git Commit: f5382591874220287de253bfc08b10afd5244927
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [65 64 63]
Go Version: go1.13.5
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=/home/ubuntu/gopath
GOROOT=/usr/local/go
`
OS & Version: `Linux, ubuntu 16.04`
Commit hash :`f5382591874220287de253bfc08b10afd5244927`

#### Expected behaviour

Geth start

#### Actual behaviour

panic of "out of memory"

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

geth --datadir data --unlock 0xe7e549d77b7e8ece9194147395745d2f83ad6301 --password pw --allow-insecure-unlock --mine --rpc --rpcapi web3,eth,net

#### Backtrace

> geth --datadir data --unlock 0xe7e549d77b7e8ece9194147395745d2f83ad6301 --password pw --allow-insecure-unlock --mine --rpc --rpcapi web3,eth,net

~It's the command for mainnet. Perhaps you can set the `networkID` then Geth won't bump the memory allowance as many as mainnet.~. 

Although the datadir contains your customized genesis, but now you have to specify the `networkID` otherwise the default ID is 1.

Besides, is your Geth starts without doing anything and then crash? Like your machine has 8GB memory, it shouldn't OOM that fast.
Yes, the geth node does nothing and then crash. I will try to restart geth node as you say. So if the geth can't get enough memory place, it may crash?
Usually, 8GB is not enough for mainnet. But I have no clue why during the setup the Geth will eat 8GB memory.

The crash dump seems to indicate that the fast sync bloom filter is the one that blew up. That insta-allocates on startup a fair chunk of memory, though it should still only be the trie dirty cache size.

@manxiaqu Could you check what `free` prints and share it? Curious how much RAM your system reports as free.

Also if you run with `--cache=1024` to deliberately reduce the defaults, does Geth start up? If yes, it should print a line `Allocated fast sync bloom                size=XXX MB`, could you please share that?

I can't find the log info `Allocated fast sync bloom`.

The issue seems to be that your machine is already fully saturated wrt RAM usage. It says you have 350MB free + 1.3GB used for buffers that can be reclaimed. Starting Geth with a 2.5GB cache allowance will blow through the available RAM instantly.
